meanings.definition: Cloth or material produced by weaving or knitting fibers
meanings.sent1: The soft fabric felt smooth against her skin.
meanings.sent2: She bought a beautiful fabric to make a dress.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous kitten played with the fabric, unraveling it in seconds.
meanings.sent4: The fabric of society is woven with threads of diversity and unity.
meanings.sent5: The vibrant fabric of the tapestry depicted a scene from ancient times.

meanings.definition: The structure or framework of a building or object
meanings.sent1: The steel beams formed the fabric of the skyscraper.
meanings.sent2: The fabric of the tent provided shelter during the storm.
meanings.sent3: The fabric of the chair seemed to have a mind of its own, adjusting to each sitter.
meanings.sent4: The fabric of the city's history was visible in its architecture.
meanings.sent5: The intricate fabric of the spider's web glistened in the sunlight.

meanings.definition: The essential structure or foundation of something
meanings.sent1: Trust is the fabric that holds relationships together.
meanings.sent2: The fabric of the argument was based on solid evidence.
meanings.sent3: The fabric of the plan unraveled when unexpected challenges arose.
meanings.sent4: Hope is the fabric that weaves through the darkest of times.
meanings.sent5: The fabric of teamwork is essential for success in any project.
